page.title: 13DAY IN THE LIFE OF A FARMER
page.content: MR.Alan Hewitt is vice chairman of the National Farmers Union.He has lived at Dunham Hall Gardens since 1966.He has a wife,Caroline,and 2 children;Chris,who is 14 years old and goes to North Cestrian Grammar School. They have 2 dogs.A house dog called Sue,who is a Jack Russel and a guard dog called Ben,who is a Golden Labrador. At 6.00 a.m,Mr. Hewitt wakes up. But sometimes at 4.30 a.m, he drives his wagon to Manchester market to sell his produce. For breakfast, Mr. Hewitt has wholewheat bread and cereals. After breakfast, Mr. Hewitt cuts the lettuce in the glass houses, he then spends an hour watering the young lettuce. He feeds the lettuce and the plants and vegetables and checks that there are not any problems like green, white,blackfly and red spiders.
